definition: to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: The expenses on advertising and sales promotion will be shared between our two parties.
sentences.chinese: 广告和促销的费用由我们双方均摊。

sentences.english: To ensure maximum sales for in-house facilities and cross sell other Regent destinations by continuously promoting them upon inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 确保最大限度地促销本酒店以及连锁酒店的产品。

sentences.english: Hopefully this form of online promotion will pull the consumer in.
sentences.chinese: 这个形式的在线促销极有可能将吸引客户。

sentences.english: Premium sales is a kind of promotional activities.
sentences.chinese: 附赠式有奖销售是一种促销活动。

sentences.english: The EU reckons that Intel's use of such rebates was nefarious.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟认为，英特尔利用返点促销用意恶毒。

sentences.english: Likewise, good sales promotion activities are complementary to branding.
sentences.chinese: 同样，好的促销活动对品牌起到互补作用。

sentences.english: Beware of sale items, which make you feel like you must buy.
sentences.chinese: 当心促销品，因为它们会让你感到自己不能不买。

sentences.english: Placing banner advertisements on other webpages is a common form of e-promotion.
sentences.chinese: 在网页上添置广告栏是最普遍的一种促销。

sentences.english: This artcle dicusses several promotion strategies on the present commercial sports fitness club marketing aspects.
sentences.chinese: 就目前商业体育健身俱乐部营销方面谈几点促销技巧。

sentences.english: This as it happens can cooperate network of countrywide sales promotion.
sentences.chinese: 这正好可以配合奥维思的全国促销网络。

sentences.english: These eye-catching title is the role played by marketing.
sentences.chinese: 这些耀眼的名称的确起到了促销的作用。

sentences.english: We"ve only sold our product at trade fairs, not in an on-going sales campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们的产品只在商展时展售，而没有办促销活动。

sentences.english: A: Yes, I do. I have worked as a salesman for P&G Company Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 有，我在宝洁公司做过促销员。

sentences.english: We are very interested in an exclusive arrangement with your factoryfor the promotion of your products in Bahrain.
sentences.chinese: 盼望能成为贵公司独家代理，促销在巴林市场的货品。

sentences.english: In soccer-mad Brazil, it heavily promoted golf clubs. In sweltering Mexico, it pushed ice skates.
sentences.chinese: 在对足球疯狂的巴西，它积极的促销高尔夫球棒。

definition: to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
see 光棍節|光棍节[Guang1 gun4 jie2]
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
